questions.question_text: A systems administrator plans to upgrade a server to the latest operating system. Which of the following should the administrator do before placing a change request?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Establish a scope
Here's why:

 Establish a scope: Before proceeding with a change request, the systems administrator should clearly define the scope of the upgrade. This includes identifying the objectives of the upgrade, the expected outcomes, and the resources required. Establishing a scope helps to ensure that all involved parties understand what will be changed and the potential impact on the environment.

Selected Answer: A
Establishing a scope: means clearly defining the parameters of the upgrade, including which servers will be affected, the target operating system version, the expected timeline, and any potential impacts on applications or services. This provides a clear framework for the change request and helps ensure everyone involved is on the same page.
-Google

questions.question_text: A Windows user wants a filesystem that protects confidential data from attackers who have physical access to the system. Which of the following should the user choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I wanted to nominate D. But since there is already a problem--- A will be my Answer
Educate user is a perpetual action in the work place, before any problems

Selected Answer: A
correct answer is A

questions.question_text: A user's PC is performing slowly after the user clicked on a suspicious email attachment. The technician notices that a single process is taking 100% of RAM, CPU, and network resources. Which of the following should the technician do first?

choices.D: Educate the user about cybersecurity best practices
choices.A: Disconnect the computer from the network

questions.question_text: A company wants to reduce the negative ecological impacts of its business and has decided to hire an e-waste company to dispose of equipment. Which of the following should the e-waste company provide the business?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The e-waste company should provide the business with a:

B. Certification of destruction

A certification of destruction is a formal document that verifies the proper disposal of electronic equipment, ensuring that it was handled and destroyed in compliance with environmental regulations and standards.

Selected Answer: A
A. top

The top command provides a dynamic, real-time view of system processes, including their CPU and memory usage.
